div.l: And ȝet haue I all wey a coltes toth
As many a ȝeere as hit is passed henne
Syn that my tappe of lyf began to renne
For sikerly whan I was borne a none
Deth drough the tappe of lyf ⁊and lete hit gone
And euer sithen haith so the tappe yronne
Till that almost all empty is the tonne
The streme of lyf now droppeth on the chynne
The sely tonge may wele rynge ⁊and chymbe
Of wretchednesse that passyd is full ȝore
With olde folk saue dotage is the more
Whan that oure ooste had herd this ʆsermonyng
He gan to speken as lordely as a kyng
He seid what amonteth all this wytte
What shall we speke all day of holy wrytte
The deuell made a refe for to preche
Or of a souter a shipman or a leche
Sey forth thi tale and tarye not the tyme
Lo depford and hit is half wey pryme
Loo Grenewhich that many a shrew is In
Hit were al tyme thy tale for to gynne
Now sirs qᵈuod this Oswold Refe
I pᵃraye ȝow all that ȝe noȝt ȝoᵘ grefe
Þogh I ansuere and somdele sette his houwe
For leuefull hit is with force of shouwe
This dronken myller hath ytold vs here
How that begyled was a carpenter
ꝐParauenture in scorn for I am one
And by youre lefe I shall hym quyte anone
Right in his cherles termes will I speke
I pᵃray to god his nekke more to breke
He can wele in myn eye see a stalke
But īn īn his owne he can noȝt seen a balke
